Articles.Content:
So I've recently run into a RAM issue where... well, I have a lot of mods and KSP freaks out.

If I installed the x64 version to increase the RAM available to the program, would I still be able to use x86 mods?

Should be able to. The mods are uncompiled code.

I didn't have any problems.

Yes, you can. Mods don't care what version of KSP you are running, the same mod will work on Windows32/64/Mac/Linux.

There are a very few exceptions, but the forum thread for that mod will be clear if the operating system you are running on matters. If there is no comment about it, the mod will work on any system KSP can run on.

D.

KSP Linux x64 is stable. KSP Windows x64 is not stable. It is bad enough that Squad itself says "unstable" on the option to download it. 0.25 Winx64 is far, far less stable than even 0.24.2 Winx64. Many modders refuse to support KSP Windows x64 for this reason.
